org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.em

Class HardEM

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.WeightLearningApplication
        • org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.maxlikelihood.VotedPerceptron
          • org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.em.ExpectationMaximization
            • org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.em.HardEM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelApplication
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LatentObjectiveComputer

    public class HardEM
extends ExpectationMaximization
    EM algorithm which fits a point distribution to the single most probable assignment of truth values to the latent variables during the E-step.
    Author:
    Stephen Bach

      protected double[] computeExpectedIncomp()
      Computes the expected (unweighted) total incompatibility of the GroundCompatibilityKernels in reasoner for each WeightedRule.

      Internal method for computing the loss at the current point before taking a step.
      protected double[] computeObservedIncomp() 
      protected double[] computeScalingFactor()
      Computes the amount to scale gradient for each rule Scales by the number of groundings of each rule unless the rule is not grounded in the training set, in which case scales by 1.0
      protected void doLearn() 
      protected void minimizeKLDivergence()
      Minimizes the KL divergence by setting the latent variables to their most probable state conditioned on the evidence and the labeled random variables.

    • Field Detail

      • CONFIG_PREFIX

        public static final String CONFIG_PREFIX
        Prefix of property keys used by this class.
        See Also:
        ConfigManager, Constant Field Values

      • ADAGRAD_KEY

        public static final String ADAGRAD_KEY
        Key for Boolean property that indicates whether to use AdaGrad subgradient scaling, the adaptive subgradient algorithm of John Duchi, Elad Hazan, Yoram Singer (JMLR 2010). If TRUE, will override other step scheduling options (but not scaling).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ADAGRAD_DEFAULT

        public static final boolean ADAGRAD_DEFAULT
        Default value for ADAGRAD_KEY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • minimizeKLDivergence

        protected void minimizeKLDivergence()
        Minimizes the KL divergence by setting the latent variables to their most probable state conditioned on the evidence and the labeled random variables.

        This method assumes that the inferred truth values will be used immediately by VotedPerceptron.computeObservedIncomp().

        Specified by:
        minimizeKLDivergence in class ExpectationMaximization

      • computeExpectedIncomp

        protected double[] computeExpectedIncomp()
        Description copied from class: VotedPerceptron
        Computes the expected (unweighted) total incompatibility of the GroundCompatibilityKernels in reasoner for each WeightedRule.
        Specified by:
        computeExpectedIncomp in class VotedPerceptron
        Returns:
        expected incompatibilities, ordered according to kernels

        Description copied from class: VotedPerceptron
